Description: Blue glazed composition shabti of Djedptahi(u)fankh with black painted detail: a lappet-wig tied with a fillet, outlined eyes and crossed arms in relief holding two relief hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a seed-basket.
Curator's comments: The owner of the shabti is probably to be identified as the Third Prophet of Amun Djedptahiuefankh, buried in the Royal Cache at Deir el-Bahri: the shabti is one of five presented by Petrie in 1885, the others being all of persons buried in the Royal Cache (EA 16052-3, 16055-6). There are actually two shabtis bearing the number EA 16054 - the second one inscribed with the title Third Prophet of Amun and the name Djedptahiuefankh.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
